title: English print around 1700
content:
I am looking for typefaces used by English printers around 1700. Both clean fonts and fonts with a rough appearance to look as the old printed original book page. Preferably of the same style as the attached example.

And what is the correct classification of these fonts?

For refernece: classic writers of the period are John Milton, Henry Fielding and Daniel Defoe. Image source: [http://adoptabook.vassar.edu](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114150/http:/adoptabook.vassar.edu/ "http://adoptabook.vassar.edu")

Font: 

 IM Fell English Roman 

Solved By: 

 [donshottype](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114150/http:/typophile.com/user/205259 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [history\_of\_tom\_jones.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114150/http:/typophile.com/files/history_of_tom_jones.jpg) | 1.66 MB |
author: litton

comments.content:
As close as you are going to get with a digital font:  
IM Fell English Roman  
 [http://iginomarini.com/fell/the-revival-fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114150/http:/iginomarini.com/fell/the-revival-fonts/ "http://iginomarini.com/fell/the-revival-fonts/")  
Based on type from the era.  
Don

a few more to consider:  
1592 Garamond GLC  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/glc/1592-glc-garamond](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114150/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/glc/1592-glc-garamond "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/glc/1592-glc-garamond")  
Old Claude LP  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/letterperfect/old-claude](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114150/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letterperfect/old-claude "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/letterperfect/old-claude")  
Janson  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/search/janson](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114150/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/janson "http://www.myfonts.com/search/janson")  
Celestia Antiqua MVB  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mvbfonts/mvb-celestia-antiqua](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114150/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mvbfonts/mvb-celestia-antiqua "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mvbfonts/mvb-celestia-antiqua")  
Regula STF  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/regula](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114150/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/regula "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/regula")  
Don

Thank you so much for those excellent suggestions. I think I will go with IM Fell English Roman for my current project. And I was happy to read that Fell was the cause of iKern, since iKern has helped my favourite modern type designer Jos Buivenga (exljbris).

You're welcome. Good luck with your book project.  
Don
